meanings.definition: A test that is part of a larger test.
meanings.sent1: During the math subtest, students answered questions about fractions.
meanings.sent2: The reading subtest was challenging for some students.
meanings.sent3: The science subtest decided who would be the champion of the test-taking competition.
meanings.sent4: Her performance on the history subtest was a key piece of the puzzle in determining her overall grade.
meanings.sent5: The subtest on vocabulary included questions about synonyms and antonyms.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will subtest the students on their spelling abilities tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She subtests each student individually to assess their understanding of the material.
meanings.sent3: The principal subtested the entire class to measure their progress throughout the semester.
meanings.sent4: The researcher subtested the participants to gather data for the study.
meanings.sent5: He subtests regularly to ensure accurate evaluation of student performance.

meanings.sent1: The subtest scores indicated areas where students needed additional support.
meanings.sent2: Her subtest results showed improvement compared to the previous assessment.
meanings.sent3: The class eagerly awaited the subtest outcomes to see how they had performed.
meanings.sent4: The subtest data provided valuable insights into student learning patterns.
meanings.sent5: His subtest grades were higher than expected, surprising both him and his teacher.
